alert.note: Alert for Bibb; Houston; Jones; Monroe; Twiggs (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 4:51AM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Monroe, Bibb, Twiggs, Jones and Houston Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Macon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ocmulgee River near Macon. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand. Large portions of the Macon GreenWay Ocmulgee Heritage Trail floods north of the Martin Luther King Boulevard bridge. The flood waters will be up to 3 feet deep on portions of the trail. Large portions of agricultural lands east of Macon and well downstream will be under 1 to 5 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 23.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM EST Friday was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 14.0 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.1 feet on 07/11/1916. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
